678901:
PROCEDURE NOTE

Patient: [REDACTED]
MRN: [REDACTED]
DOB: [REDACTED]
Date: [REDACTED]
Location: [REDACTED]

Attending Physician: Dr. David Chen, MD - Interventional Pulmonology

Indication: Anterior mediastinal mass with suspected thymic pathology; biopsy for diagnosis prior to treatment planning

Procedure: Thoracoscopy with diagnostic biopsy of mediastinal lesion

Anesthesia: General anesthesia with LMA

Details:
62-year-old female with 3.5cm anterior mediastinal mass noted on staging CT for newly diagnosed breast cancer. PET shows mild uptake. Concern for thymoma vs lymphoma vs metastatic disease.

Patient [REDACTED] anesthesia. Right lateral decubitus position. Left chest entered via single 2cm incision at 4th ICS anterior axillary line. 5mm 30-degree thoracoscope introduced.

Findings: Anterior mediastinal mass visible through mediastinal pleura, approximately 3.5cm, encapsulated appearance. No pleural studding or effusion.

Biopsy: Mediastinal pleura incised. Multiple deep forceps biopsies (x8) obtained from lesion. Tissue appears solid and pale. Specimens sent for frozen and permanent pathology.

Frozen section: Thymic tissue with features suggestive of thymoma; final pending.

Small 14Fr chest tube placed. Lung re-expanded. Patient extubated and taken to recovery in stable condition.

D. Chen, MD
